meanings.definition: Declare one's public approval or support of
meanings.sent1: I endorse the idea of helping others in need.
meanings.sent2: The mayor decided to endorse the new community center project.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot tried to endorse its favorite snack.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to endorse the happiness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright rainbow seemed to endorse the beauty of nature.

meanings.definition: Sign (a check or bill of exchange) on the back to make it payable to someone else
meanings.sent1: Please endorse the check before depositing it.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer endorsed the document for the client.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to endorse the toy mouse as its own.
meanings.sent4: His signature seemed to endorse the importance of the contract.
meanings.sent5: The golden seal seemed to endorse the authenticity of the letter.

meanings.definition: Support or approve of (a product, service, or person) publicly
meanings.sent1: I endorse this brand for its quality products.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity endorsed the new perfume on social media.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to endorse the tasty treat in the commercial.
meanings.sent4: Her actions seemed to endorse the values of the organization.
meanings.sent5: The shining star seemed to endorse the talent of the singer.
